shatter.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to break suddenly into very small pieces, or to make something break in this way
shatter.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: The plate hit the floor, and shattered into tiny bits.
shatter.translation[0].definitions[1].de: to completely destroy or ruin something such as someone’s beliefs or life
shatter.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: A tragic accident shattered her dreams of Olympic glory.
A few weeks in a tiny damp room soon shattered his illusions about university life.
people whose lives have been shattered by war
shatter.translation[0].note_box[0].headi: – Meaning 2: to completely destroy or ruin something such as someone’s beliefs or life
shatter.translation[0].note_box[0].secti: Their hopes had been shattered by the outbreak of war.
He spoke yesterday about the injury which shattered his Olympic dream.
I hate to be the one to shatter your illusions, but you’re wrong.
The book shattered the image of the contented American housewife.
Economic studies have shattered the myth that population growth is bad for a nation’s economy.
